member.name: T:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider
member.summary: Implements the Insight provider for MySql connections.

member.name: F:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider._parameterPrefixRegex
member.summary: The prefix used on parameter names.

member.name: F:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider._supportedTypes
member.summary: The list of types supported by this provider.

member.name: M:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.RegisterProvider
member.summary: Registers this provider. This is generally not needed, unless you want to force an assembly reference to this provider.

member.name: M:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.CreateDbConnection
member.summary: Creates a new DbConnection supported by this provider.

member.name: M:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.DeriveParametersFromStoredProcedure(System.Data.IDbCommand)
member.summary: Derives the parameter list from a stored procedure command.

member.name: M:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.CloneParameter(System.Data.IDbCommand,System.Data.IDataParameter)
member.summary: Clones a parameter so that it can be used with another command.

member.name: M:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.GetTableSchemaSql(System.Data.IDbConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Returns SQL that queries a table for the schema only, no rows.
member.param: The name of the table to query.
member.returns: SQL that queries a table for the schema only, no rows.

member.name: M:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.IsTransientException(System.Exception)
member.summary: Determines if a database exception is a transient exception and if the operation could be retried.
member.returns: True if the exception is transient.

member.name: P:Insight.Database.Providers.MySql.MySqlInsightDbProvider.SupportedTypes
member.summary: Gets the types of objects that this provider supports. Include connectionstrings, connections, commands, and readers.
